# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia code to solve this task. 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
This function uses the `map` function to apply a function to each element in a column of a DataFrame. The function extracts the year and month from each DateTime, multiplies them together (to get the yearmonth as an integer), and adds it to the DataFrame under a new column named "ym".

You can use this function like this:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[]) # create your dataframe here
add_yearmonth(df)
```
